author: Staff Reporter
text:
The city police on Tuesday claimed that chain snatching incidents in the city have reduced due to intensified vehicle checks and patrolling.

Addressing the media, Deputy Commissioner of Police (Crime and Traffic) S. Prabakaran said that no chain snatching incidents have taken place in January 2016 when compared to three incidents in January 2015.

Vehicle checks

He said that based on the directions of City Police Commissioner Sumit Sharan, personnel in all the stations were carrying out regular vehicle checks every day apart from intensifying patrolling round-the-clock.

He said that three burglary incidents, 55 sovereign gold jewellery burgled in Annathanapatti, 17.5 sovereign gold jewellery in Fairlands and 77 sovereign gold jewellery in Suramangalam, had taken place during last month.

Teams

“Special teams were formed to nab the accused in the three incidents”, he added.

Mr. Prabakaran said that 10,000 cases under Motor Vehicles Act were booked in January 2016 and a fine of Rs. 15 lakh was collected from the violators. He said that action will be taken against traffic violators in the city.
title: Police claim reduction in chain snatching incidents
